overview.problemStatement: The list chromatic number χL(G)" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">χL(G)χL(G)\chi_L(G) is defined to be the minimal k" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">kkk such that for any assignment of a list of k" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">kkk colours to each vertex of G" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">GGG (perhaps different lists for different vertices) a colouring of each vertex by a colour on its list can be chosen such that adjacent vertices receive distinct colours. Does every planar graph G" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">GGG have χL(G)≤5" role="presentation" style="position: relative;">χL(G)≤5χL(G)≤5\chi_L(G)\leq 5? Is this best possible?
